member.name: T:RelhaxModpack.Atlases.Packing.ArevaloRectanglePacker
member.summary: Rectangle packer using an algorithm by Javier Arevalo

remarks.para: Original code by Javier Arevalo (jare at iguanademos dot com). Rewritten to C# / .NET by Markus Ewald (cygon at nuclex dot org). The following comments were written by the original author when he published his algorithm.

You have a bunch of rectangular pieces. You need to arrange them in a rectangular surface so that they don't overlap, keeping the total area of the rectangle as small as possible. This is fairly common when arranging characters in a bitmapped font, lightmaps for a 3D engine, and I guess other situations as well.

The idea of this algorithm is that, as we add rectangles, we can pre-select "interesting" places where we can try to add the next rectangles. For optimal results, the rectangles should be added in order. I initially tried using area as a sorting criteria, but it didn't work well with very tall or very flat rectangles. I then tried using the longest dimension as a selector, and it worked much better. So much for intuition...

These "interesting" places are just to the right and just below the currently added rectangle. The first rectangle, obviously, goes at the top left, the next one would go either to the right or below this one, and so on. It is a weird way to do it, but it seems to work very nicely.

The way we search here is fairly brute-force, the fact being that for most off-line purposes the performance seems more than adequate. I have generated a Japanese font with around 8500 characters and all the time was spent generating the bitmaps.
Also, for all we care, we could grow the parent rectangle in a different way than power of two. It just happens that power of 2 is very convenient for graphics hardware textures.
I'd be interested in hearing of other approaches to this problem. Make sure to post them on http://www.flipcode.com

member.name: T:RelhaxModpack.Atlases.Packing.ArevaloRectanglePacker.AnchorRankComparer
member.summary: Compares the 'rank' of anchoring points
member.remarks: Anchoring points are potential locations for the placement of new rectangles. Each time a rectangle is inserted, an anchor point is generated on its upper right end and another one at its lower left end. The anchor points are kept in a list that is ordered by their closeness to the upper left corner of the packing area (their 'rank') so the packer favors positions that are closer to the upper left for new rectangles.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Atlases.Packing.ArevaloRectanglePacker.AnchorRankComparer.Default
member.summary: Provides a default instance for the anchor rank comparer

member.summary: Compares the rank of two anchors against each other
member.param: Left anchor point that will be compared
Right anchor point that will be compared
member.returns: The relation of the two anchor point's ranks to each other

member.name: T:RelhaxModpack.Atlases.Packing.RectanglePacker
member.summary: Base class for rectangle packing algorithms

remarks.para: By uniting all rectangle packers under this common base class, you can easily switch between different algorithms to find the most efficient or performant one for a given job.
An almost exhaustive list of packing algorithms can be found here: http://www.csc.liv.ac.uk/~epa/surveyhtml.html

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.ModsDir
member.summary: The name of the 'mods' directory, stored in the root World_of_Tanks folder.
member.remarks: The 'new' method for installing mods into the client. It mostly contains configuration data and mod packages, which are zip files with no compression.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.ResModsDir
member.summary: The name of the 'res_mods' directory, stored in the root World_of_Tanks folder.
member.remarks: The 'old' method for installing mods into the client. It's for legacy mods that haven't been updated to the package structure. All files are dumped into the folder and loaded as they are, to replace stock files.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.WoTVersionXml
member.summary: The name of the xml file in the World_of_Tanks folder used for getting the current client version information.
member.remarks: At the time of this writing, the version is stored as something like "". Using string splitting and trimming, the number combination before the # is the same number used for the version dirs in the mods and res_mods folders. The xpath to get the version is /version.xml/version.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.PatchFolderName
member.summary: The name of the installer folder that used to hold all patch instruction files in for processing.
member.remarks: The installer used to create this folder to write, order and process patches that would be inside the package zip files. Now, the information is stored in the database.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.ShortcutFolderName
member.summary: The name of the installer folder that used to hold all shortcut instruction files in for processing.
member.remarks: The installer used to create this folder to write and process shortcut creation instructions for processing. Now, the information is stored in the database.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.XmlUnpackFolderName
member.summary: The name of the installer folder that used to hold xml unpack instruction files in for processing.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.AtlasCreationFoldername
member.summary: The name of the installer folder that used to hold atlas creation instruction files in for processing.
member.remarks: The installer used to create this folder to write and process atlas creation instructions for processing. Now, the information is stored in the database.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.FontsToInstallFoldername

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.ReadmeFromZipfileFolderName

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Common.ApplicationConstants.MinimumDotNetFrameworkVersionRequired
member.summary: The minimum release value of the user's installed .NET framework to use the modpack.

member.name: M:RelhaxModpack.Database.Category.OnParsingPropertyToXmlElement(RelhaxModpack.Database.XmlDatabaseProperty,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Object,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A hook from XmlComponent for when an xml entry is being loaded. This can be used to handle custom or one-off conversions to manage any legacy serialization issues (for example, old database formats never had a wrapping "Packages" element).
member.param: The xml database property entry being loaded. For example, the "Packages" list entry.
The xml element entry of the current object being loaded. For example, the "Category" element.
The version of the schema currently being loaded.
The info meta-data about the property in the class object to be written to. For example, the "Packages" list property.
The current value of the property in the object. For example, this would be the list object of the "Packages" list property.
The xml element entry of the property being loaded. For example, the "Packages" xml entry.
A flag used back in XmlComponent if the current xml element to load (like "Packages") should continue to be loaded by XmlComponent.

member.name: M:RelhaxModpack.Database.Category.OnParsingPropertyFromXmlElement(RelhaxModpack.Database.XmlDatabaseProperty,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Object,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A hook from XmlComponent for when an xml entry is being saved. This can be used to handle custom or one-off conversions to manage any legacy serialization issues (for example, old database formats never had a wrapping "Packages" element).
member.param: The xml database property entry being saved. For example, the "Packages" list entry.
The xml element entry of the current object being saved. For example, the "Category" element.
The version of the schema currently being saved.
The info meta-data about the property in the class object to be read from. For example, the "Packages" list property.
The current value of the property in the object. For example, this would be the list object of the "Packages" list property.
The xml element entry of the property being saved. For example, the "Packages" xml entry.
A flag used back in XmlComponent if the current xml element to save (like "Packages") should continue to be saved by XmlComponent.

member.name: M:RelhaxModpack.Database.Category.OnFinishedLoadingFromXml(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A hook from XmlComponent for when an xml entry is finished being loaded into an object.
member.param: The xml element of the entry being loaded. For example, the "Category" xml element.
The status of the loading of this object, if all properties of it were previously loaded correctly.

member.name: M:RelhaxModpack.Database.XmlComponent.OnParsingPropertyToXmlElement(RelhaxModpack.Database.XmlDatabaseProperty,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Object,System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: A hook for when an xml entry is being loaded. This can be used to handle custom or one-off conversions or implementations to manage any legacy serialization issues (for example, old database formats never had a wrapping "Packages" element).
member.param: The xml database property entry being loaded. For example, the "Packages" list entry.
The xml element entry of the current object being loaded. For example, the "Category" element.
The version of the schema currently being loaded.
The info meta-data about the property in the class object to be written to. For example, the "Packages" list property.
The current value of the property in the object. For example, this would be the list object of the "Packages" list property.
The xml element entry of the property being loaded. For example, the "Packages" xml entry.
A flag used back in XmlComponent if the current xml element to load (like "Packages") should continue to be loaded by XmlComponent.

member.param: The xml database property entry being saved. For example, the "Packages" list entry.
The xml element entry of the current object being saved. For example, the "Category" element.
The version of the schema currently being saved.
The info meta-data about the property in the class object to be read from. For example, the "Packages" list property.
The current value of the property in the object. For example, this would be the list object of the "Packages" list property.
The xml element entry of the property being saved. For example, the "Packages" xml entry.
A flag used back in XmlComponent if the current xml element to save (like "Packages") should continue to be saved by XmlComponent.

member.summary: Interaction logic for RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.xaml
RelhaxInstallTaskReporter

member.name: M:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of the RelhaxInstallTaskReporter and init the UI side of it

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.LoadedAfterApply
member.summary: Flag for when the object has been fully constructed by the UI Dispatcher.
member.remarks: Due to the multi-threaded nature of the progress reporting, progress may be reported before the reporting UI objects are fully constructed. This results in null exceptions. By using a flag to determine if the object is fully created, the reporting progresses won't try to update properties of null objects

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.ReportState
member.summary: Controls the UI state of the thread reporter

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.IsSubProgressActive
member.summary: Toggle if the second progress bar should be visible
member.remarks: Some tasks (like zip file extraction) have "sub-tasks" that take enough time where tracking their progress is warranted. For example, a zip file has many files to extract. That's the main task. However, each file has bytes to extract. If the file to extract is large, a subtask to track the extraction progress could be useful

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.TaskTitle
member.summary: The name of this task to display

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.TaskText
member.summary: The main reporting description of this task. Supports string formatting

member.summary: The minimum value for the main task progress bar

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.TaskMaximum
member.summary: The maximum value for the main task progress bar
member.remarks: This value can be changed for, example, the number of patches to run

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.TaskValue
member.summary: The current progress of this task. Value must be between Maximum and Minimum.

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.SubTaskMinimum
member.summary: The minimum value for the subtask progress bar

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.SubTaskMaximum
member.summary: The maximum value for the subtask progress bar

member.name: P:RelhaxModpack.UI.RelhaxInstallTaskReporter.SubTaskValue
member.summary: The current value of the subtask progress. Must be between the maximum and minimum

member.name: T:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode
member.summary: List of possible return code error conditions that can occur when running an automation task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.None
member.summary: No error occurred, it ran correctly.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ExecuteException
member.summary: There was an unhandled program exception during the task main execution method.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ValidateCommandsFail
member.summary: There was an error in the 'validate commands' step of the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ProcessResultsFail
member.summary: There was an error in the 'process results' step of the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.RunTaskFail
member.summary: There was a general error running the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.IOFail
member.summary: There was an IO related error running the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ShellFail
member.summary: There was a process execution shell related error running the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.DatabaseLoadFail
member.summary: There was an error loading the modpack database.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.DatabaseSaveFail
member.summary: There was an error saving the modpack database.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.FileDownloadFail
member.summary: There was a file download related error running the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.FileUploadFail
member.summary: There was a file upload related error running the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ProcessMacrosFail
member.summary: There was an error processing macros when running the task.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ComparisonNoFilesToUpdate
member.summary: There were no files found during the compare session that needed to be updated. This is no an error, but meaning there is no work to do.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.ComparisonManualFilesToUpdate
member.summary: There were files found during the compare session that need to be manually updated.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationExitCode.Cancel
member.summary: The task was canceled.

member.name: T:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationCompareMode
member.summary: The different behaviors of the comparison

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationCompareMode.NoMatchContinue
member.summary: If the file hashes are different, then continue the sequence. This is the primary behavior.
member.remarks: The implied use of this mode is that if the hashes are different, then the application needs to continue to update the version of the package in our database

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.Utilities.Enums.AutomationCompareMode.NoMatchStop
member.summary: If the file hashes are different, then stop the sequence with appropriate exit code.
member.remarks: If the exit code associated with this enumeration occurs, then it implies that this file must be manually inspected and cannot be an automated change

member.summary: Determines if the library is loaded into memory.

member.summary: Attempts to unload the library.

member.summary: Extracts the embedded compressed library to the location in the Filepath property.

member.summary: The location of the WoT installation directory parsed at installation time
member.remarks: The path is absolute, ending at "World_of_Tanks"

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.MainWindow.WoTClientVersion
member.summary: The version information of WoT parsed at installation time
member.remarks: This info is gathered from the "version.xml" file from the game's root directory

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.MainWindow.WoTModpackOnlineFolderVersion
member.summary: The version of the online folder name containing the zip files for this game parsed at installation time
member.remarks: The online folders are done by major versions only i.e. 1.4.1, 1.5.0, etc. All zip files on 1.5.0.x are stored in this folder

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.MainWindow.DatabaseVersion
member.summary: The version of the database parsed upon application load

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.MainWindow.FirstLoad
member.summary: Determines if this is the first time the application is loading, parsed upon application load
member.remarks: Done by checking if the settings file exists. If it is set to true in the application, it will be set to false again when it closes.

member.name: F:RelhaxModpack.MainWindow.FirstLoadToV2
member.summary: Determines if while being the first time loading, if this is an upgrade operation to Relhax V2, parsed upon application load
member.remarks: Done by if FirstLoad is true and the Relhax V1 settings file exists
